chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John S Finley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Deparmtent of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------

Follow through with all treatment recommendations, including a sex offender evaluation and follow through, at discretion of Agent.
-----------------------------

No contact with the victim, her sister, her mother, or her father without both their consent, and the consent of the Agent. No contact, other than incidental, with anyone under the age of 18.
-----------------------------
Comply with the State of Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

9:35 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.   
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Ellen Henak in court on behalf of deft John S Finley in court, in custody.  
Matter is before the Court for the defendant's post-conviction motions requesting the Court vacate judgment and order a new trial.  
Court has reviewed the written submissions of both sides.  
9:36 am  Melissa Frost is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Henak.  
9:42 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
9:50 am  Redirect by Atty Henak.  
9:51 am  Witness excused.  
9:51 am  Atty Johnson does not have any witnesses.  
9:52 am  Court has reviewed the Briefs of the parties.  
9:52 am  Argument by Atty Henak.  
9:52 am  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
9:55 am  Court makes record that Court Reporter lost power.  She reads back portions of argument that she has.  
9:56 am  Atty Henak makes record as to what she previously argued.  
9:56 am  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
10:01 am  Court makes record and denies the first prong of the motion.  
10:17 am  Court next addresses the 2nd prong on the defendant's Motion.  
Court makes record as to her review of the file, including review of transcripts.  
10:19 am  Atty Henak will rely on written submissions on the 2nd prong.  
10:19 am  Atty Johnson also does not believe she has anything to add.  
10:20 am  Court makes record.  Court adopts findings made by Judge Reddy on March 27 of 2015 in terms of voluntariness.  Court is also independently looking at everything involved with this case. Court believes State has met its burden that the statement was voluntary.  Motion to vacate judgment is denied.  Defendant's Motion is denied in total.  Atty Henak will submit an Order.  10:29 am  Court in recess.

BOND QUASHED

2:34 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DDA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft John S Finley in court, in custody with Atty Melissa Anne Frost.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing hearing.  Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  Court has reviewed contents of the file and presided over the trial.  The Court has reviewed the PSI as well as the victim's statements contained within the PSI.  
2:37 pm  Attorney Frost has reviewed the PSI with her client.  Atty Frost makes a record with regard to corrections to the PSI.   
2:43 pm  Statement by Daniel Prince, father of victim.  
2:45 pm  Statement by Linda Reed on behalf of the defendant.  
2:46 pm  Statement by Atty Frost that defendant's mother, Holly Finley, is present in Court.  
2:47 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
2:59 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Frost.  
3:15 pm  Mr. Finley does not wish to make a statement.  
3:16 pm  Court takes recess to consider this matter and will return with its decision.  
3:23 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Court proceeds with making its record / findings and sentencing the defendant.  Father of victim makes statement that there is no restitution being requested.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence:  30 years prison;  
20 years IC followed by 10 years ES;  
Not eligible for CIP or SAP;  
176 days dead time credit - to be confirmed by jail records;  

CONDITIONS of Extended Supervision:  
1)  No contact with the victim, her sister, her mother or her father without both their consent and the consent of the Agent.  
2)  No contact, other than incidental, with anyone under the age of 18.  
3)  Follow through with all treatment recommendations including a sex offender evaluation and follow through, at discretion of Agent.  4)  Comply with the State of Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.  
5)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Court gives defendant warnings:  1)  May not possess firearms;  2)  Cannot vote until civil rights are restored;  3)  Cannot work / volunteers with children (S. 948.13);  4)  Cannot possess body armor.  
3:46 pm  Court in recess.

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen and George Clettenberg.  CLERK:  feefee
8:22 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances are the same.   
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft John S Finley in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.

Exhibits offered and received:  #9, #10

8:45 am  Court excuses Jurors from courtroom at request of Attys.

Exhibit can be provided to Doctor for her testimony and it can be entered into the record afterwards.  If jury later asks to see the exhibit during their deliberations, it can be redacted at that time.  
8:50 am Jury seated in courtroom.  Continued direct exam of Dr. Sheets by Atty Johnson.  
9:07 am  No cross by Atty Frost.  Jurors have no question of Dr. Sheets.  
9:07 am  State rests subject to calling any rebuttal witnesses.  

9:09 am  Dr. David Thompson is sworn and testifies on exam on Atty Frost.  

Exhibits marked and identified:  #17, #19, #18
Exhibit offered and received:  #17

9:50 am  Jury excused from courtroom for morning recess.  
9:51 am  Court in recess.  

10:03 am  Court in session.  Jury seated in courtroom.  
10:03 am  Continued direct exam of Dr. Thompson by Atty Frost.  
10:51 am  Sidebar between Court and Attys at request of Atty Frost.  
10:52 am  Cross exam of Dr. Thompson by Atty Johnson.  
11:53 pm  Jurors preference is take lunch now and return at 1:00 pm for continued testimony.  
11:54 pm  Jury excused.  

12:59 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  
12:59 pm  Court makes record as to prior discussion Court had with Attys in hallway, outside presence of jurors.  
1:00 pm  Attorney Frost advises that Mr. Finley has made the decision not to testify in this matter.  
1:01 pm  Court has colloquy with Mr. Finley as to his constitutional right to testify or not testify
1:02 pm  Court takes recess to allow Atty Frost to further discuss this with Mr. Finley.  
1:04 pm  Court back in session.  Court continues colloquy with Mr. Finley.  Atty Frost makes record of her discussions with Mr. Finley and also her discussions with Atty Schwantes who was the deft's prior counsel.  Atty Frost believes his decision not to testify is being made freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court believes Mr. Finley understands the decision he is making.  Court finds he is freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waiving his right to testify.  
1:07 pm  Atty Frost also advises that she does not intend to call any other witness.  State will not have any rebuttal witnesses.  

1:10 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
1:10 pm  Continued cross exam of Dr. Thompson by Atty Johnson.   
1:17 pm  Redirect by Atty Frost.  
1:24 pm  Exhibits 18 and 19 are moved into evidence by Atty Frost and received by the Court.  
1:24 pm  Recross by Atty Johnson.  
1:24 pm  No questions by Jurors.  Dr. Thompson is excused.
1:25 pm  Atty Frost has no other witness.  State has no rebuttal witness.  
1:25 pm  Record is closed.  
1:26 pm  Court addresses jurors about next steps in the trial and whether they wish to stay tonight and finish or come back tomorrow.  
1:27 pm  Jurors would like to stay and get this done today.  Jurors are excused from courtroom.  

1:32 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Atty Johnson intends to include a lesser included charge of first degree sexual assault of a child, under the age of 13, sexual contact.  1:32 pm  Atty Frost objects and makes further record.  1:33 pm  Court makes record that it finds it to be a proper motion to make and Court grants motion.  DA office staff is working on the Jury Instruction for the lesser included.  Court next deals with jury instruction for repeated acts of sexual assault of a child.  Court drafted an Instruction and the Court's clerk provided the Attys with a copy yesterday.  Attys have no objection to the instruction drafted by the Court.  Court goes through the jury instruction packet with the Attys.  
1:59 pm  Court in recess.  

2:20 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  State has provided Court with Jury Instruction.  
2:28 pm  Court makes record with regard the order in which the Instructions will be read by the Court.  
2:30 pm  Attys agree that instructions are legally correct.  

2:33 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
2:33 pm  Court Instructs the Jury.  
2:57 pm  Closing argument by Atty Johnson.  
3:20 pm  Court takes short recess.  

3:29 pm  Court in session.  Jury seated in courtroom.  
3:29 pm  Closing argument by Atty Frost.  
3:53 pm  Rebuttal argument by Atty Johnson.  
3:59 pm  Court gives final Instructions.  
4:00 pm  Alternate Jurors are released at this time.  5185 and 2503
4:01 pm  Clerk swears in Bailiffs.  
4:02 pm  Court addresses alternate jurors to explain they may still not discuss this case with anyone until a verdict is reached.  
4:02 pm  Jurors are excused from courtroom to begin deliberations.  

4:03 pm  No objection by Attys to Instructions as read to Jurors.  Court proposes combining instructions 112, 2107 and 2102 into a single instruction to make it easier for the Jurors.  Attys agree.  
4:04 pm  Court takes short recess.  

4:18 pm  Court in session with Deft and Attys.  Court provides Attys with copy of Instruction for their review.  Court makes record as to how the Instructions were originally read to Jurors.  Court has now prepared a "combined" Instruction.  Attys are in agreement with the Court's drafted Instruction.  
4:20 pm  Court in recess.  

4:28 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Jury has sent out a note.  They would like to watch C.P.'s video.  Attys have no objection.  

4:34 pm  Jurors are seated in courtroom and have been provided with a copy of the transcript of C.P.'s interview.  Exhibit 3 is played for the Jurors.  
5:13 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom to resume deliberations.  
5:13 pm.  Court in recess.  

5:43 pm  Court in session with Attys and deft.  Court has been advised by Bailiffs that Jury has reached a verdict
5:44 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  
5:44 pm  Judge reads verdicts.  Deft found guilty of count charged in the Information.  
5:45 pm  Atty Frost would like the jury polled.  Court polls jurors.  Court thanks Jurors for their service in this case.  
5:47 pm  Jurors are excused.  

5:47 pm  Atty Johnson asks Court to accept the verdict as rendered by the Jury.  Court enters a judgment of conviction.  Court will order a PSI and set matter for sentencing hearing.
5:48 pm  Atty Johnson asks that Mr. Finley's bond be revoked.  Argument by Atty Frost requesting deft remain out on bond pending sentencing.  Court makes record and orders bond revoked pending sentencing hearing.  Atty Frost asks that the cash bail be returned to the person who posted.  Court so orders.  

SENTENCING HEARING ON:  November 29, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. before Judge Drettwan  (1 hour)

5:51 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 6/16/2017: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
Voir Dire List
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire
Seating for 14

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen and George Clettenberg.  CLERK:  Lori S. 
Defendant John S Finley in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:23 am  Appearances made. Matter before the Court for Jury Trial. Court addresses issue as to witnesses and number of convictions. Haley Johnson makes a record as to witnesses with criminal records, number and nature of convictions. Response by Atty. Frost as to convictions of witness.
Court makes a finding and rules that prior convictions may be used for impeachment purposes. Argument by DDA Johnson. Court stands by its ruling. Record made by DDA Johnson as to offer extended to the defendant. Atty. Frost makes a record that Atty. Schwantes did convey the offer to the defendant. Defendant responds to Court's questions. 
8:32 am - Court addresses jury instruction 2107 and other acts analysis. Response by DDA Johnson who agrees with the Court, and makes a record that her focus will be on the two instances committed in Walworth County. DDA Johnson requests that said instruction should specify Walworth County. 
8:35 am - Response by Atty. Frost regarding jury instruction. State chooses to refer to Jefferson County acts as other acts evidence.  Discussion as to additions of definitions of "intercourse" and "contact". Response by the Court who will allow instruction as provided by DDA Johnson. Parties agree that said instructions should be read prior to evidence.
8:41 am - DDA Johnson addresses defendant's interview and any potential redaction. State has copies of transcripts of both interviews (defendant and victim) and will request jury to follow along as video is played. DDA Johnson addresses information in therapy session regarding truthfulness of victim. Court will take matter under advisement and rule prior to testimony of therapist and Dr. Thompson. Atty Frost has copy of report for Court to review.
8:47 am - Atty. Frost addresses sequestration as to rebuttal witnesses. DDA Johnson will ensure that all witnesses including rebuttal are instructed as to sequestration/exclusion rule. Atty. Frost addresses segments of Or's reports that need to be excluded due to their content with respect to defendant's prior legal history. Response by DDA Johnson. 
Court in recess @ 8:53 am.

Motions to strike for cause for number of jurors. Five (5) jurors are struck for cause, (6047, 1678, 2914, 2208). Court back in session with new jurors seated in box. Court continues voir dire. Three (3) more jurors struck (422, 752, 1995).
11:30 am - Voir Dire by the State. 11:30 am - Parties meet with two jurors in chambers in response to DDA Johnson's voir dire. No motions to strike for cause. 
11:44 am - Back in courtroom. State's voir dire continues.

12:48 pm - Court in recess for lunch. Court will resume at 2:00 p.m.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 6/15/2017: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
of Videotaped Statement of a Child, Offer of Proof, and Request for Hearing

Attorney Melissa Anne Frost appeared.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:09 p.m. Defendant's appearance was excused from today's hearing. Court addresses video and informs the parties that she has reviewed the tape. Atty. Frost does not object to the showing of the video, but does not want the door open for other acts evidence. Discussion and State will clarify to the jury when video is shown. Stipulation under 908.08 that the videotaped statement will be introduced as evidence in the case. Court supplements record as to 908 motion and analysis. Due to stipulation of parties, Court will not do another analysis now that victim has turned 12 years old under 908.08(4). Court addresses jury instructions. Defense has filed theirs. State will file by 3:00 pm on Friday. Court turns to location on the video that is not in Walworth County. Defense does not object to this introduction as long as this addresses only other acts and do not open the door. Court makes a record as to analysis under 904.04(2). Response by DDA Johnson and Atty. Frost. 
Court addresses other motions in Limine. Court makes a record as to Judge Reddy's ruling regarding possible testimony of defendant. Any witnesses except for court officer and support person for victim will be excluded as soon as voir dire is completed. DDA asks that both parents be allowed with the victim during the trial. Response by Atty. Frost that as long as they do not discuss the case, she has no objection. Court will allow both parents to be in the courtroom but they are to be instructed not to discuss the testimony during the trial. ADA Rea will be meeting with her officers with regard to background checks on any witnesses. Court will address this on Monday morning. State verifies that all evidence/discovery has been completed. Court makes a record as to prior rulings by Judge Reddy with respect to Goodchild motions.
3:25 p.m. - DDA Johnson makes a record as to expert and lay witnesses testimony. 
Court makes a record as to strikes (5 each); alternates (2); note taking; pre marking exhibits. State will pre mark her exhibits; Atty. Frost informs the Court that she does not have a witness coming in until Wed. morning.
Atty. Frost asks if the State will be playing the entire video and about transcript for video. Court will address during trial if needed. Atty. Frost makes a request as to jury asking questions. Response by DDA Rea. Response by the Court. DDA Rea to let Court know by 3:00 pm on Friday as to whether or not she objects to jury asking questions.
Parties have nothing further. parties to be here at 8:15 on Monday morning.  Jury will be brought up at 9:00 a.m.

Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia

Court in session 2:58pm
Attorney Travis Schwantes and Melissa Frost present in court on behalf of Defendant John S Finley.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In court today for oral ruling.  
Court makes findings as to Dr Thompson's report:
Repeated interviewing - is relevant
External influences - is not relevant
Inappropriate interviewing techniques - is relevant
Source/ Misattribution errors - Statement that it is not relevant by ADA Johnson.  Statement by Atty Schwantes that this should be a jury decision and it goes to weight vs. admissibility.  Response by ADA Johnson. - Court finds it is relevant
Interviewer bias - is relevant
Therapy affects - is relevant
Prohbitive value vs. risk to jury
Court clarifies what Dr Thompson can testify to.  
Statement by ADA Johnson.  
False confessions - Dr Thompson is qualified to testify.  Reliability of the proctoring of the test goes to weight vs. admissibility.  Court finds the results found by Dr. Thompson are relevant.  
Statement by Atty Schwantes requesting withdrawl from the case.  Court will grants his request.  
Court adjourned 3:28pm

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 3/13/2017: COURT REPORTER EILEEN GRZENIA**

2:30 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant John S Finley in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.   
Matter is before the Court on the State's Motion in Limine regarding the testimony of Dr. David Thompson.  
Court received and reviewed Attorney Schwantes' letter Brief yesterday and was disappointed to hear that the Dr. Thompson was not available for testimony today.  Court believes testimony is necessary.  Atty Johnson is prepared to proceed today.  Attorney Schwantes apologizes for not being able to secure Dr. Thompson's appearance here today.  Attorney Schwantes makes record with regard to the time it took to retain Dr. Thompson and for him to prepare his report.  Dr. Thompson is not available until the week of trial.  Court indicates that potentially we could hear the Motion hearing on June 15 or 16 when the Doctor is available if the Court's other trials that week resolve or if only a 2-day trial goes.  Court notes if the trial is reset, it would be heard by Judge Drettwan.  Attorney Johnson's preference would be that the Judge who tries the case would also hear the Motion.  Attorney Schwantes will defer to the Court as to how to proceed.  Court will take the matter off the trial calendar for June 13th and will keep it on for the pre-trial to find out what other case is going to trial. the week of June 13th.  Court will excuse the Defendant from appearing at the final pre-trial.  Attorney Schwantes can be available by phone for the final pre-trial or Attorney Frank Raff can appear on his behalf.  Court has no problem with Attorney Raff appearing at the final pre-trial on behalf of Atty Schwantes.  Court asks counsel if the trial will be longer than the 4 days currently set if Dr. Thompson is allowed to testify?  Attorneys believe 5 days would be sufficient for trial.  Court reschedules final pre-trial and Jury trial dates.  Court still hasn't decided whether Judge Drettwan should hear the Motion and will make the decision at the time of the final pre-trial.  

Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
2:46 pm  Court in recess.
